choiceresponse.p: What happens when you use the NOACK option with XREADGROUP?
choiceresponse.label: Choose two answers:

checkboxgroup.choice: The message delivery semantics will change from at-least-once to at-most-once.
Messages returned are added to the consumerâ€™s Pending Entries List (PEL).
The consumer will need to acknowledge each message manually after processing it using the XACK command.
Redis will consider all messages returned by XREADGROUP to be acknowledged.

div.p: When using the NOACK option with XREADGROUP, Redis considers all messages read by XREADGROUP to be automatically acknowledged whether the client successfully processes them or not. This means that stream processing will then operate in an at-most-once delivery semantic. The pending entry list will not be maintained for the consumer, and the consumer will not be required to acknowledge successful processing of messages using the XACK command.
